title: Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: First Floor Room Plans/Furniture Layout", January 26, 1937
medium: Graphite, black ink, and red color pencil on tracing paper, double ruled border in graphite
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: DONALD DESKEY/ 630 FIFTH AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite in stamp, lower right: JOB NO. 553-5/1/4"-1'-0"/ANDERSON, SAENGER/1/26/37, 2/15/37, OFFICE/3/5/37; lower center in graphite: MR. HAROLD ANDERSON HOUSE BEL AIR CAL./FURNITURE LAYOUT - FIRST FLOOR - SCALE 1/4"=1'-0"; descriptions in graphite
description: Floor plan and furniture placement plan for first floor. Porch, two maid's rooms, bath, kitchen and laundry on west side of plan; pantry and breakfast room at right. Staircase on north wall, large dining room with oval dining table and chairs on south wall. Entrance hall and main doorway to right of stairs; library on south wall with porch off room. Coat room and toilet to the right of the main entrance. Large living room, extending from north to south wall at far right; porch off living room at upper right. Placement of furniture and indication of furniture numbers throughout.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: First Floor Room Plans/Furniture Layout", January 26, 1937.
January 26, 1937. Graphite, black ink, and red color pencil on tracing paper, double ruled border in graphite. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-621.
